thread.title: Moncton house fire disrupts Rogers TV service
thread.title_full: Moncton house fire disrupts Rogers TV service

author: cbc
title: Moncton house fire disrupts Rogers TV service
text:
A fire that destroyed three empty houses in Moncton over the weekend disrupted Rogers TV service in the city, Dieppe and parts of Shediac, the company says.
The suspicious fire happened Saturday night on Park Street, just east of the Moncton Garrison.
The fire damaged fibre lines, which affected service to Rogers customers, said Heather Robinson, senior manager of regional public affairs for Rogers Communications.
"Once fire, police and hydro crews secured the area near the fire, our team was permitted to go in and begin restoration," she wrote in an email to CBC News.
Customer seeks answers Rogers customer Marlene Wheaton said she wasn't told what caused the outage.
"We have called several times and all we get is recording that says there is major outages and they can't give you a time frame as to when it'll be back on," she said.
Robinson said that crews were working hard to repair the lines and that services should be back online today.
Sgt. Mario Fortin said weather had slowed the investigation into the Park Street fire.
"It's hard for us to reach some people of interest or people we want to talk to," he said. "It's slowing us down a little bit today so hopefully by tomorrow we would be able to pick up and keep investigating."
